citation.article-title: Proposal of Solimonas aquatica sp. nov., reclassification of Sinobacter flavus Zhou et al. 2008 as Solimonas flava comb. nov. and Singularimonas variicoloris Friedrich and Lipski 2008 as Solimonas variicoloris comb. nov. and emended descriptions of the genus Solimonas and its type species Solimonas soli
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Solimonas soli Kim et al. 2007
The description is as given by Kim et al. (2007) with the addition that the type strain is motile by means of a single polar flagellum and is oxidase-positive.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 68.4 mol%.
The polar lipids also include phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine, three uncharacterized phospholipids and three additional uncharacterized aminophospholipids.
